subject: Re: [junit] Dependencies between test-methods
msgSnippet: ... Why would you want to do that. That is, use the parser for setting up your fixture? ... I see. ... Then the next step would probably be reducing the
messageBody:
Stefan Schulze wrote:

> Currently, I'm working on a simple parser and evaluator. In this example, I have lot's of tests to verify the parsers correctness. When I write the tests for the evaluator, I want to use the parser for setting up my fixture.
> In this example, a failure of the parser causes the failure of the evaluator.

Why would you want to do that. That is, use the parser for setting up
your fixture?

> It would be nice to mark the evaluator-tests to depend on the parser-tests. A failure of the parser only causes the skipping of the evaluator-tests. This would ease the the search for the source.

I see.

> If I try to reduce the complexity of a method, it usually only results in some private (and thereby untestable) methods.

Then the next step would probably be reducing the complexity of the
class... ;) See http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?MethodsShouldBePublic

Cheers, Ilja
